body_html:
I am having the same problem.

The issue was introduced in:
d90054e#diff-ebe39eb12501b7ce2eb92ffd71b9acac

and reversed in:
dce9a49#diff-ebe39eb12501b7ce2eb92ffd71b9acac

I'm using colaboratory: Is there any way to reload tensorflow after updating?

print('tensorflow v={}'.format(tf.__version__))
!pip install tensorflow==1.6.0  --upgrade
!pip show tensorflow # shows v1.6.0
import importlib
importlib.reload(tf) # raises NameError: name 'python' is not defined
print('tensorflow v={}'.format(tf.__version__)) # shows v.1.6.0-rc1

** updated** I just manually kill -9 every python process and colaboratory just restarted

body:
I am having the same problem. 

The issue was introduced in:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/d90054e7c0f41f4bab81df0548577a73b939a87a#diff-ebe39eb12501b7ce2eb92ffd71b9acac

and reversed in:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/dce9a49c19f406ba45919e8c94474e55dc5ccd54#diff-ebe39eb12501b7ce2eb92ffd71b9acac

I'm using `colaboratory`: Is there any way to reload tensorflow after updating?

```
print('tensorflow v={}'.format(tf.__version__))
!pip install tensorflow==1.6.0  --upgrade
!pip show tensorflow # shows v1.6.0
import importlib
importlib.reload(tf) # raises NameError: name 'python' is not defined
print('tensorflow v={}'.format(tf.__version__)) # shows v.1.6.0-rc1
```

** updated** I just manually `kill -9` every python process and `colaboratory` just restarted
